00029 /***************************************************************************//**
00030  * Header file for using FT232R to do SPI communications by bit-banging.
00031  *
00032  * Note that these functions will simply exit the application if there is an
00033  * error communicating with the FT232R.
00034  *
00035  * The calls to these functions take quite some time. To speed up the
00036  * application try to call these functions as few times as possible (send as
00037  * much data together as you can).
00038  *
00039  * @file ftSpi.h
00040  * @date 27-Jan-2010
00041  * @author Se√°n Harte
00042  ******************************************************************************/
00043 
00044 
00045 #ifndef FT_SPI_H
00046 #define FT_SPI_H
00047 
00048 
00049 /**
00050  * FTDI AN232R application note recommends less than 1Mbps. The actual clock
00051  * rate is 16 times this value.
00052  **/
00053 #define FTSPI_MAX_BAUDRATE          921600
00054 
00055 
00056 /**
00057  * Initialises FT232R device in bit-bang mode for SPI communication. This must
00058  * called before using the other functions in this header.
00059  *
00060  * @param device description of the SPI device that will be communicated
00061  *     with. This contains a string description which must match the string in
00062  *     in the FT232R internal EEPROM, and also defines which pins to use for
00063  *     MISO, MOSI, SCK, and nCS.
00064  **/
00065 void ftSpi_init(spiDeviceInfo_t* device);
00066 
00067 
00068 /**
00069  * Simultaneously reads and writes a number of bytes using the SPI protocol by
00070  * bit-banging over the FT232R. Note that each call to this function takes
00071  * a relatively large time to return, so try to call it as few times as
00072  * possible. The calling code should send as much data as it can with one call
00073  * to this function.
00074  *
00075  * @param[out] misoData where to store bytes that are read. If this is NULL,
00076  *     then read data will be ignored.
00077  * @param mosiData pointer to bytes to write.
00078  * @param count how many bytes to read/write.
00079  * @param chipSelect if @c true then the chipSelect line is enabled before
00080  *     communicating, and disabled afterwards; otherwise the chipSelect line is
00081  *     not changed.
00082  **/
00083 void ftSpi_readWrite(uint8_t* misoData, const uint8_t* mosiData,
00084                      uint32_t count, bool chipSelect);
00085 
00086 
00087 /** Brings chip select low. (Also, note that SCK will be low). **/
00088 void ftSpi_enableChipSelect(void);
00089 
00090 
00091 /** Brings chip select high. (Also, note that SCK will be low) **/
00092 void ftSpi_disableChipSelect(void);
00093 
00094 
00095 /** Closes the FT232R device. Should be called before the program exits. **/
00096 void ftSpi_close(void);
00097 
00098 
00099 #endif
